title: Unable to open on Ubuntu 14.10
body:
When I try to run mist in my terminal, this error comes up:

```
tyler@tyler-HP-ProBook:~$ mist
rlp: input list has too many elements for types.Header, decoding into (types.Block)(struct { Header *types.Header; Txs []*types.Transaction; Uncles []*types.Header; TD *big.Int }).Header
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x54887e]

goroutine 1 [running]:
runtime.panic(0xadb7c0, 0x15b3728)
    /usr/lib/go/src/pkg/runtime/panic.c:266 +0xb6
```

I think what solved it for me was starting over - try renaming ~/.ethereum to something else

We have made several incompatible changes on the develop branch that will produce crashes like this if the database is not deleted.

Resetting the database is the official "fix" for this issue.�
There was a change in the block chain database which causes this issue. There's no "proper" way to resolve this other than remove the block chain database.
